files.content:
locals {
  name_prefix = "${var.project_name}-${var.environment}"

  # If a domain is provided, we create ACM + HTTPS listener + Route53 record.
  enable_custom_domain = length(trimspace(var.domain_name)) > 0

  # If no custom domain, we expose HTTP only.
  enable_https = local.enable_custom_domain

  # ECR image used by ECS. CodePipeline/CodeBuild will push tags; service uses :latest by default.
  image_tag = "latest"
}

files.name: README.md
files.content:
# Terraform: Static Nginx site on ECS Fargate with CI/CD

This Terraform stack provisions:
- VPC (2 public + 2 private subnets), IGW, NAT gateways, and VPC endpoints (S3, ECR api/dkr, CloudWatch Logs)
- ALB (HTTP; optional HTTPS with ACM + Route53)
- ECS Fargate cluster/service/task definition running an Nginx container from ECR
- ECR repository + lifecycle policy
- CodeCommit repo, CodeBuild project, CodePipeline (Source->Build->Deploy to ECS)
- CloudTrail trail (to S3)

## Notes
- The ECS service uses the ECR image tag `latest` by default. CodeBuild pushes both `latest` and a short commit SHA tag.
- If you set `domain_name` and `hosted_zone_id`, Terraform will create an ACM certificate (DNS validated) and an HTTPS listener, plus a Route53 alias record.

## Deploy
```bash
cd ai_tf
terraform init
terraform validate
terraform plan
```
